column4: Where is a good place to ask a question about encrypted partitions not booting?  In particular, /dev/disk/by-uuid seems to be missing.
I think you just asked in a good place. If anyone knows the answer they will speak up Im sure.
I saw ur post earlier, is this a widows ap, or linux app that did the PGP encrypt?
... but not a partition encryption... a full disk encryption..
ok, and you encrypted the partition Post UB installation ?
I need to think on that one fer a bit, but I dont think you'll get through the encryption layer with a bootloader, but could be wrong.
Would such a thing change the UUID of the partition?  That seems to be my issue.
I had Karmic running successfully Linux encrypted partition + PGP Desktop full disk encryption on top of it.
I'm not familiar with the app your referring too, I've not used it, nor can I see a reason for it, but that's here nor there. Can you use this windows app to remove this encryption ?
In theory, yes.  But that's not my first choice:  It's a 10 hour commitment to do so.

I can't tell you how Grub2 is reacting to the encryption layer, I just don't, and to try and fix this from within the Linux environment, make cause all sorts of issues. Many things have changed from Karmic to Lucid.

I wasn't looking to make any changes other than config changes.  I wanted to see if I could figure out a way to manually boot into the partition... to start, where is it getting the UUID that is in the error message?
I tried booting into rescue, but blkid returns nothing.

My recommendation would be to go to the PGP Windows people and ask them how to fix the problem, as you asking Linux folks to understand what a Windows app is doing to a Linux machine :-) wow that's interesting.
I'm not asking linux folks to understand PGP desktop... I'm asking which part of the boot process is out of synch on a linux machine.  Where is the broken connection?
it seems the root cause was the secondardy encrypt, beyond that Im out of suggesitons.
Fair enough.  Is there a channel for grub2?
not a ubuntu channel no, seach the channel listing fer grub.
